title: Echoes of the Drift
body: The station drifted above the rust-red world, its corridors humming as if the alloy remembered every footstep that had ever crossed it.

title: Pilot Light
body: Mara tapped the console; starlines unraveled into a tidy map. Somewhere in that cold lattice, a signal blinked, stubborn as hope.

title: Archive Rain
body: It rained inside the data-vault when the coolant lines failed, a glittering monsoon where memories flowed in silver sheets.

title: Quiet Engines
body: They said the new drives were silent, but silence has a texture; you feel it press against your ribs when the ship jumps.

title: Signal Garden
body: On the lunar plain, antennas bloomed like iron flowers, drinking the sky for whispers of ships too shy to be seen.

title: Dust Psalms
body: Every rover sings to the dust, a low hymn of motors and grit, and the dust answers by climbing into every promise of a seal.

title: Glass Orbit
body: From orbit the ocean looked like shattered glass, each shard a storm, each gleam a city threading its cables through the wind.

title: Caretaker
body: The caretaker drone learned to pause beside the observatory window, as if it too needed to breathe between the stars.

title: Borrowed Sun
body: We wore the borrowed sun on our wrists, thin bands that poured daylight into the tunnels where the old world slept.

title: Wake Protocol
body: Wake the captain last, the manual said, because captains carry storms in their eyes when the century turns without them.

title: Thread of Ions
body: Ions stitched a bright seam across the void as the freighter stitched decades into hours, time quilting around its hull.

title: Static Orchard
body: We planted transmitters in the static like saplings, hoping one day the wind would carry fruit in the shape of answers.

title: Second Moon
body: They built a second moon from scaffolds and songs, and the tides learned a new step, hesitant and beautiful.

title: Cold Sleep
body: Sleep is a country where the borders move; in cryo, the map freezes, and you wake with old news in your lungs.

title: Neon Pilgrims
body: We followed neon through the undercity, pilgrims of light, trading prayers for passwords at every rusted gate.

title: Hullflower
body: A flower grew from the ship's wound, a frost-white bloom of crystallized coolant that rang when the captain laughed.

title: Orbital Night
body: Orbital night came like a curtain; the station dimmed, and the stars stepped onstage, endlessly rehearsing the same old play.

title: Spindle City
body: The city climbed the elevator cable in spirals, balconies brushing clouds, markets spinning where gravity grew bored.

title: Borrowed Bones
body: We left our heavy bones on Earth and wore lighter ones in orbit, hollow and eager as birds.

title: Lagrange Tea
body: At Lagrange we brewed tea that never spilled; the leaves turned like galaxies in cups, and we drank orbits until we were brave.
